rusty_mos1.0.0

Module env

  • Structs
  • Statics
  • Functions

In rusty_mos::kern

Module rusty_mos::kern::env

source ·
Expand description

Core methods for the env module.

Structs§

  • EnvsWrapper
    Wrapper to make it aligned to a page.

Statics§

  • ASID_BITMAP
    Bitmap for the asid allocatoin.
  • BASE_PGDIR
    The global pgdir.
  • CUR_ENV
    The current env.
  • ENVS
    The envs array used in the kernel space. The element in it has the link field to make it a link node.
  • ENVS_DATA
    The envs array in kernel, mapped to the UENVS and used by the user program.
  • ENV_FREE_LIST
    Free env list.
  • ENV_SCHE_LIST
    Runnable env list.
  • PRE_ENV_RUN
    Run before the env_run for tests only

Functions§

  • env_alloc⚠
    Alloc an env and setup its vm and PCB.
  • env_create⚠
    Create an env and load the icode, set the priority. For tests mainly.
  • env_destory⚠
    Destory an env and free it. Re-schedule will be performed.
  • env_free⚠
    Free an env, and remove all its pages. The TLB will be flushed after the deletion of pages.
  • env_init
    Init the env environment. Put the envs into the free list, and map the PAGES and ENVS to base_pgdir’s UPAGES and UENVS accordingly.
  • env_pop_tf⚠
    Recover from exception, load the specified TrapFrame.
  • env_run⚠
    Run the env. Save the CUR_ENV’s trapframe if CUR_ENV exists.
  • env_setup_vm⚠
    Setup the virtual memory of the new-born env.
  • envid2env⚠
    Get the env’s PCB by its id. If checkperm is set, the method will check whether the env just is CUR_ENV or the child of CUR_ENV. If not, KError::BadEnv will be returned with a Err wrapper.
  • load_icode⚠
    Load the icode for the e.
